hints.content:
On a clock there are two hands. The $\redD{\text{hour hand}}$ is the shorter hand.  The $\blueE{\text{minute hand}}$ is the longer hand.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/45a764740b107b33cf6707c08fe70c7abdbda8c9)

The hour hand is between $5$ and $6$, so it is after $5$ o'clock but not yet $6$ o'clock.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/cceb63d74f1f29778c9dc79ae9867443f9b76fd8)

The hour is $5$.

The minute hand starts pointing straight up for $0$ minutes.  

When counting minutes, the distance between each tick mark represents $1$ minute.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1ab12f55cf150cf2bc6ccbb9f8bee6c187fafa8e)

Each number on the clock represents $5$ minutes, with a total of $\blueE{60}$ minutes in each hour.

We can relate the clock to a number line. 

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fd29a2021824302ac67d097fa87cb10a3d576906)

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ea7c805e5a365c863405c53bdfd84e00ecefe614)

The minute hand is at $50$ minutes past $5{:}00$.

question.content:
**What time is it?**

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4d41bf1fcbfb871fc4778b6dd810982361b9a373)

The time is [[☃ numeric-input 1]] : [[☃ numeric-input 2]].
